FwkSenCnt.COMMENT: For PHASE 2B TRANSLATORS: the brief examples are formulaic and not from the corpus.
FwkSenCnt.MEANING: a French-speaking woman, especially as a form of address or title

ExCnt.EX: "Madame," said he, as the quadrille ended, "do not go back to the odious corner where you have been burying your face and your dress until now.
Madame lived on the ground-floor, and Monsieur on the first floor.

FwkCorPattCnt.CORPAT: nearly always abbreviated before a name

ExCnt.EX: Despite the difficulties of 1783, the Revd Cambridge and Mme d'Arblay remained on friendly terms.
The maid had the day off and Mme Bawa had been out, so we ate a combination of the previous weeks meals with aubergine and a fried egg on top.
